title: Dagestan's Jewish community 'feels betrayed' after anti-Semitic riots
summary: Since the attack on Makhachkala airport by a mob looking for a plane carrying Israelis or Jews, the small indigenous community in the Russian Caucasus remains in shock.

title: Surrounded by ruins, Gazans mourn their city's 'dead soul'
summary: Almost half of the buildings in Gaza City, which had a population of over a million before the war, have been destroyed or damaged by Israel's bombardments in retaliation for Hamas's attack on October 7.

title: BRICS urges 'immediate, durable and sustained' truce in Gaza
summary: The BRICS groups of nations called for a truce in Gaza during a virtual meeting, during which South Africa accused Israel of 'war crimes' and acts 'tantamount to genocide.'

title: More than two months after the earthquake in Morocco: 'We don't know how we're going to get through the winter in these tents'
summary: As temperatures continue to fall, not all disaster victims have received the emergency aid promised by the Moroccan government. Many are living in precarious conditions.

title: Javier Milei's narrow leeway in Argentina
summary: The day after his victory, the far-right president-elect gave details about some of his free-market economic policies. But, lacking a majority in the National Congress, he will face tough challenges to implement them.

title: 'Napoleon,' Bonaparte and his private battlefield
summary: Ridley Scott superimposes the Emperor's love life on his feats of battle, leaving aside the political dimension. Starring Joaquin Phoenix and Vanessa Kirby.

title: North Korea says spy satellite launch successful
summary: Pyongyang said Wednesday it had succeeded in putting the military satellite in orbit after two previous failures, as the US led its allies in condemning the launch as a 'brazen violation' of UN sanctions.

title: France presents Alps' bid to host 2030 Winter Olympics
summary: The French proposal presented Tuesday would use ski sites across the French mountains and ice rinks in the coastal city of Nice on the French Riviera.

title: Crypto exchange Binance CEO pleads guilty to anti-money laundering charge
summary: Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, has agreed to pay over $4 billion in an agreement with US authorities as Changpeng Zhao, its CEO and founder, pleaded guilty to failure to maintain an effective anti-money-laundering program.

title: Gaza ceasefire: Arab and Muslim countries seek Beijing's support
summary: The diplomatic delegation would like China to use its growing influence in the Middle East to find a political solution to the conflict.

title: Airlines predict global pilot shortages as aircraft orders go through the roof
summary: According to the International Air Transport Association, the world's aircraft fleet is set to double in size in the next 20 years, putting further pressure on pilot recruitment.

title: From friends to foes: The Canadian tale of two Michaels accused of spying in China
summary: Michael Spavor and  Michael Kovrig were released in 2021 after 3 years of imprisonment for 'spying.' Spavor has now accused Kovrig of having given information to the Canadian government, lending credence to the Chinese allegations.

title: How San Francisco slammed the brakes on robo-taxis
summary: Following a horrific accident on October 2, Cruise, General Motors' autonomous vehicle subsidiary, has suspended its fleet of self-driving cars throughout the US.

title: War in Ukraine: Kyiv seeks to open new front on banks of Dnipro River
summary: Ukrainian troops are stepping up their incursions on the left bank of the river, which has been occupied by Russian forces since the early days of the war, and are attempting to establish a bridgehead there.

title: In New York, high heels are standing tall
summary: Some products and practices, born in the United States, are spreading around the globe. In her column, Le Monde's Guillemette Faure looks at classes for walking in heels at a time when Birkenstocks and other sandals are gaining cult status.

title: Macron tells Xi of 'deep concern' over Russia and North Korea military cooperation
summary: In a phone conversation with the Chinese leader on Monday, the French president told his Chinese counterpart that this cooperation would 'naturally lead to fuelling the scope of Russian aggression,' reported the Elysée.

title: French MEPs race to rescue the Camembert box
summary: On Tuesday, November 21, the European Parliament is due to debate the Commission's draft regulation on packaging waste. The vote will be held on Wednesday.

title: French-Palestinians evacuated from Gaza share their stories: 'We were waiting for death'
summary: According to the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 115 people – French nationals, their dependents and the staff of the French Institute – have been repatriated to France from Gaza. They worry about their friends and family still in the enclave.

title: Netherlands: Geert Wilders, the latest spoiler in a knife-edge general election
summary: The far-right leader, who has watered down his anti-Islam program, is buoyed by the latest polls ahead of Wednesday's November 22 vote.

title: Sweden to impose 'honorable lifestyle' as Residency Condition
summary: On Tuesday, the ruling coalition of right-wing and far-right parties announced its intention to expel foreign citizens who fail to respect the kingdom's 'fundamental values.'

title: Israeli Cabinet approves cease-fire with Hamas that includes release of some 50 hostages
summary: Israel and Hamas agreed to a four-day truce that would see the Palestinian group release dozens of hostages taken on October 7, both sides announced Wednesday.

title: Basildon, a journey into the heart of the UK's stagnating economy
summary: As Rishi Sunak's government presents its budget on Wednesday, November 22, it faces a stagnant economy and an  cost of living crisis.

title: The five surprises of the James Webb telescope
summary: After a first annual cycle of observations of the Universe's youth, the spectacular images sent back by the space telescope have already upset many astrophysicists' predictions. Everything in the cosmos happened earlier and faster than expected.

title: Scientists finally identify protein responsible for initiating ovarian development in embryo
summary: More than thirty years after the discovery of the genetic signal responsible for embryonic masculinization, a French team has pinpointed the subtle mechanism that triggers ovarian growth.

title: OpenAI says its co-founder Sam Altman to return as CEO, days after being fired
summary: Altman was fired by the board  of OpenAI on Friday, and was then hired by Microsoft on Sunday. OpenAI announced that he would return to the company on Tuesday.

title: Palestinian ambassador to France Hala Abou Hassira watches her city be 'pulverized' in bombings
summary: The Gazan diplomat has lost 60 family members in the Israeli bombings. She has been the Palestinian Authority's representative in France for the past two years.

title: Why Palestinian prisoners are central to the cease-fire deal
summary: The agreement approved by Israel on Wednesday morning plans for the release of 150 Palestinian prisoners in exchange for the release of 50 women and children held hostage by Hamas. A total of 6,700 Palestinians are believed to be imprisoned by Israel, and some prisoners have died since the attack on October 7.

title: The unbearable wait for families of Israeli hostages
summary: Hadas Kalderon, mother of two children kidnapped by Hamas on October 7, does not know if they will be among the hostages released under the agreement approved on Wednesday by Benjamin Netanyahu's government.

title: Backed by Microsoft, Sam Altman returns as OpenAI CEO
summary: The internal drama at the company that created ChatGPT has taken another twist: Sacked on Friday, the co-founder is back and an interim board of directors has been appointed.

title: Israel-Hamas war: The five weeks of back-channel talks that led to a truce
summary: Fifty women and children held by Hamas in Gaza will be released in exchange for 150 Palestinian prisoners and a limited truce.

title: 'The challenger may have changed, but the world's leading superpower is still on top'
summary: In three decades, China has replaced Russia in the rivalry between the United States and the USSR. The mid-November summit between Joe Biden and Xi Jinping showed that American power remains unchallenged, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: EU parliament scraps proposal to halve pesticide use
summary: In a 299-to-207 vote, the recommendation was refused, reflecting right-wing parties' desires to win votes from farmers before the EU elections in June.

title: France refuses to pay up for failing to meet renewable energy targets
summary: In 2009, the government pledged to achieve a share of 23% renewables (wind, solar, hydro) in its gross final energy consumption by 2020. But it only reached 20.7% in 2022.

title: UK unveils sweeping tax cuts in budget ahead of election
summary: British Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt delivered an autumn statement on Wednesday hoping to woo voters ahead of the 2024 general election.

title: Venezuela accuses Peru of 'kidnapping' its football team
summary: Amidst a wild night of violent clashes between Lima police, Venezuelan players and football fans, Caracas has alleged that Lima prevented 'the plane bringing the team back from refueling.'

title: 'Moscow's tone is triumphalist, and yet, the war amplifies existing handicaps of Russia's economy'
summary: While Vladimir Putin tries to show Russia at its best, the war against Ukraine has ultimately absorbed all the country's resources and lifeblood, writes Le Monde columnist Jean-Michel Bezat.
